message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try { PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(outFile)); out.println("***************************************************"); out.println("* OUTPUTS *"); out.println("***************************************************"); out.println(); out.println("--------------------------------------------"); out.println("Clarke & Wright Solution (parallel version)"); out.println("--------------------------------------------"); out.println(cwsSolution.toString()); out.println("--------------------------------------------"); out.println(); out.println("OUR BEST SOLUTION:"); out.println("--------------------------------------------"); out.println(bestSol.toString()); out.close(); } catch (IOException exception) { System.out.println("Error processing output file: " + exception); }
<<<explanation>>>: The code you provided is correct for writing to a file using PrintWriter. However, you need to make sure that you are providing the correct file path for the output file. Also, make sure that you have the necessary permissions to create and write to the file in the specified directory.
